meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Abbie Micucci Jeremy Reff John Schultz Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6982.

td.p: Abbie Micucci, a stay-at-home mom from Westborough, Massachusetts
Jeremy Reff, a business developer from Brooklyn, New York
John Schultz, a computer programmer from Ann Arbor, Michigan (whose 3-day cash winnings total $74,000)

tr.td: A REAL MYSTERY
SPORTS TALK
MINNESOTA
IT'S A FACT
SWEET! POTATOES!
NAME THAT VERB

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '"The Thousand-Dollar Tan Line" is an original mystery novel starring this detective played by Kristen Bell')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: "The Thousand-Dollar Tan Line" is an original mystery novel starring this detective played by Kristen Bell

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_1_2', 'clue_J_1_2_stuck', '(John: What is The Third Man?)
(Jeremy: What is Stranger on a Train?)
(Alex: Say it again.)
(Jeremy: What is Stranger on a Train?)
...
(Alex: You were so close, Jeremy. You forgot the "S". It\'s [*]. There were two of them.)

Strangers on a Train

JohnJeremy
Triple Stumper
')

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law. This website is not affiliated with, sponsored by, or operated by Jeopardy Productions, Inc. Join the discussion at JBoard.tv.
